dataset_description: This dataset provides hourly weather data from the IUNG2 station, including temperature, humidity, wind speed, and precipitation.

columns.name: id
columns.description: This column represents the internal identification code assigned to the weather station within the eDWIN system from which the hourly weather data is recorded.

columns.name: aggregateDate
columns.description: This column represents the start time of a one-hour time period during which weather data was aggregated at a specific weather station. The time is recorded in ISO 8601 format.

columns.name: airTemperatureMax
columns.description: This column represents the maximum air temperature, measured in degrees Celsius, recorded during a given one-hour time period at a specific weather station.

columns.name: airTemperatureMin
columns.description: This column represents the minimum air temperature, measured in degrees Celsius, observed during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station.

columns.name: relativeHumidityMax
columns.description: This column represents the highest percentage of relative humidity recorded during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station. Relative humidity is a measure of the amount of moisture in the air compared to the maximum amount of moisture the air could hold at the same temperature.

columns.name: relativeHumidityMin
columns.description: This column represents the lowest percentage of relative humidity recorded during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station. Relative humidity is a measure of the amount of moisture in the air compared to the maximum amount of moisture the air could hold at the same temperature.

columns.name: airTemperatureAvg
columns.description: This column represents the average air temperature, measured in degrees Celsius, that was recorded during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station.

columns.name: relativeHumidityAvg
columns.description: This column represents the average percentage of relative humidity that was recorded during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station.

columns.name: insolationAvg
columns.description: This column represents the average value of solar irradiance, measured over a one-hour time period at a specific weather station. Solar irradiance refers to the power per unit area (surface power density) received from the Sun in the form of electromagnetic radiation.

columns.name: windSpeedMax
columns.description: This column represents the maximum speed of the wind, measured in meters per second, that was recorded during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station.

columns.name: windSpeedMin
columns.description: This column represents the minimum speed of the wind, measured in meters per second, that was recorded during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station.

columns.name: windSpeedAvg
columns.description: This column represents the average wind speed, measured in meters per second, that was recorded over a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station.

columns.name: airPressureMax
columns.description: This column represents the maximum air pressure, measured in hectopascals (hPa), that was recorded during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station. Air pressure is a measure of the force exerted by the weight of the air above a certain point, and can be influenced by factors such as temperature, altitude, and weather conditions.

columns.name: airPressureMin
columns.description: This column represents the minimum air pressure, measured in hectopascals (hPa), that was recorded during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station. Air pressure is a measure of the force exerted by the weight of the air above a certain point, and can be influenced by factors such as temperature, altitude, and weather conditions.

columns.name: airPressureAvg
columns.description: This column represents the average air pressure, measured in hectopascals (hPa), that was recorded during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station. Air pressure is a measure of the force exerted by the weight of the air above a certain point, and can be influenced by factors such as temperature, altitude, and weather conditions.

columns.name: precipitationSum
columns.description: This column represents the total amount of precipitation, measured in millimeters, that was recorded during a specific one-hour time period at a given weather station. Precipitation refers to any product of the condensation of atmospheric water vapor that falls under gravity, including rain, snow, sleet, or hail.
